Description: THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA) AWARD RECIPIENT IS THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK - THE CITY COLLEGE. THIS  COOPERATIVE SCIENCE CENTER (CSC), FUNDED THROUGH NOAA OFFICE OF EDUCATION, EDUCATIONAL PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM WITH MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS (EPP/MSI) IS FOCUSED ON EARTH SYSTEMS SCIENCE AND REMOTE SENSING TECHNOLOGIES ALIGNED WITH THE NOAA MISSION. THE ACADEMIC HOME OF THE CENTER IS THE GROVE SCHOOL OF ENGINEERING AT THE CITY COLLEGE OF NEW YORK.  THIS IS THE SECOND FIVE-YEAR AWARD CYCLE FOR THE NOAA CENTER FOR EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCE AND REMOTE SENSING TECHNOLOGIES 9CESSRST-II).  THE PURPOSE OF THIS EPP/MSI CSC AWARD IS TO ENHANCE DEVELOPING STUDENTS THROUGH EDUCATION, AND WITH INTERNSHIPS AT NOAA, TO BE A DIVERSE CADRE OF NEW PROFESSIONALS, REPRESENTATIVE OF THE NATION'S DEMOGRAPHY, AND ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES FOR THE FUTURE NOAA MISSION ENTERPRISE WORKFORCE. THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA) AWARD RECIPIENT IS THE HOWARD UNIVERSITY. THIS NOAA OFFICE OF EDUCATION, EDUCATIONAL PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM WITH MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS ((EPP/MSI) COOPERATIVE SCIENCE CENTER (CSC) FOCUSES ON ATMOSPHERIC SCIENCES AND METEOROLOGY THAT ALIGNS WITH THE NOAA MISSION. THE ACADEMIC HOME OF THE CENTER IS THE GRADUATE SCHOOL AT HOWARD UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE IS TO ENHANCE DEVELOPING STUDENTS THROUGH EDUCATION, AND WITH INTERNSHIPS AT NOAA, TO BE A DIVERSE CADRE OF NEW PROFESSIONALS, REPRESENTATIVE OF THE NATIONS DEMOGRAPHY, AND ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES FOR THE FUTURE NOAA MISSION ENTERPRISE WORKFORCE.  THIS IS THE SECOND FIVE-YEAR AWARD CYCLE FOR THE NOAA CENTER FOR ATMOSPHERIC SCIENCES AND METEOROLOGY (NCAS-M II) FUNDED ANNUALLY, BASED ON SATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE, CONTINUED ALIGNMENT WITH NOAA MISSION AND FEDERAL APPROPRIATIONS. THE AWARD HAS A FUNDING MAXIMUM OF UP TO $30M. THE PERFORMING PERIOD IS SEPTEMBER 1, 2022 - AUGUST 31, 202

THE NOAA COOPERATIVE SCIENCE CENTER FOR LIVING MARINE RESOURCES - II (NOAA LMRCSC - II) IS COMPOSED OF A CONSORTIUM OF SEVEN INSTITUTIONS, WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND EASTERN SHORE AS THE LEAD INSTITUTION. THE PARTNER INSTITUTIONS ARE: DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY; HAMPTON UNIVERSITY; OREGON STATE UNIVERSITY; SAVANNAH STATE UNIVERSITY; THE UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI; AND, THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE.  LMRCSC PREPARES STUDENTS PRIMARILY FROM HISTORICALLY EXCLUDED COMMUNITIES AND UNDERREPRESENTED IN NOAA-MISSION SCIENCE FOR CAREERS IN RESEARCH, MANAGEMENT, AND PUBLIC POLICY THAT SUPPORT THE SUSTAINABLE HARVEST AND CONSERVATION OF THE NATION'S LIVING MARINE RESOURCES. THE COOPERATIVE SCIENCE CENTER RESEARCH FOCUSES ON MANAGEMENT OF FISHERIES RESOURCES, WITH COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH PROJECTS BETWEEN ITS PARTNER INSTITUTIONS AND NOAA IN AREAS SUCH AS STOCK ASSESSMENT, ESSENTIAL FISH HABITAT, RESOURCE ECONOMICS, AND SUSTAINABLE AQUACULTURE. THE NOAA COOPERATIVE SCIENCE CENTER FOR COASTAL AND MARINE ECOSYSTEMS (CCME) IS LED BY FLORIDA A&M UNIVERSITY.  PARTNER INSTITUTIONS INCLUDE: BETHUNE COOKMAN UNIVERSITY; CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY MONTEREY BAY; JACKSON STATE UNIVERSITY; TEXAS A&M UNIVERSITY-CORPUS CHRISTI; AND, THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS RIO GRANDE VALLEY.  CCME TRAINS STUDENTS, PRIMARILY FROM HISTORICALLY EXCLUDED COMMUNITIES AND UNDERREPRESENTED IN NOAA-MISSION SCIENCES.  CCME ALSO CONDUCTS TRAINING INCLUDING COLLABORATIONS WITH NOAA RESEARCHERS AND MANAGERS AT  THE NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE, NOAA RESEARCH, AND OTHER NOAA  OFFICES. USING AN INTERDISCIPLINARY APPROACH, CCME PREPARES STUDENTS TO BE CANDIDATES FOR THE FUTURE STEM WORKFORCE BY PROVIDING STUDENTS WITH THE SKILLS TO ADDRESS ISSUES AFFECTING MARINE AND COASTAL COMMUNITIES. CCME CONDUCTS RESEARCH FOCUSED ON THREE FOCAL AREAS - PLACE-BASED CONSERVATION, COASTAL RESILIENCE, AND COASTAL INTELLIGENCE.  FOR CCME EDUCATION AND TRAINING, AWARD-SUPPORTED STUDEN
